name: inviable
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
biology
  specialized not able to continue to exist as, or develop into, a living being: Very close inbreeding should be avoided because of the high probability of inviable or infertile offspring. 10% of the seeds were later determined to be hollow and inviable. Synonym
unviable
another word for
unviable
More examplesFewer examplesSeeds that remained at the end of each test were counted as inviable if they were soft. A further distinction might be made between species which produce viable but sterile hybrids and those which produce only inviable hybrids.
